      • terminate

        public void terminate()

      • handleTransaction

        public boolean handleTransaction(Request request,
                        Response response)
                          throws IOException
        Specified by:
        handleTransaction in interface TransactionHandler
        Parameters:
        request - - The Request message sent from the client to the server to initiate the transaction.
        response - - The Response message that will be sent from the server back to the client.
        Returns:
      • true to indicate that the handler has changed the response status code and transaction handling should be terminated.
      • false to indicate that the handler has not changed the response status code and transaction handling may continue.
        • Throws:
        IOException

      • handleDescribe

        protected boolean handleDescribe(Request request,
                     Response response)
                          throws IOException
        Handles DESCRIBE requests.

        Request Headers:

        • [Accept] - Is there a presentation description for resource URI that matches an acceptable MIME type?
        • [Accept-Encoding] What content encodings are acceptable and in what order? "*", identity, format (e.g. gzip). Does original content encoding match an acceptable encoding in list? Can the content be encoded into an encoding in the list? Order encodings by q-value. Step through list until an encoding is found for which there is a matching encoder. Bind the selected encoder to the response/entity.
        • [Accept-Language]
        • [Authorization]
        • [Bandwidth]
        • [Blocksize]
        • Connection
        • CSeq
        • [Date]
        • [From]
        • [If-Modified-Since]
        • [Pragma] impl specific
        • Proxy-Require
        • [Referer] - Ignore
        • Require - Sent to query for supported options. Default: Respond with Unsupported
        • Session
        • Timestamp - Must echo in response
        • [User-Agent]
        • [Via]
        • [WWW-Authenticate]
        Response Headers:
        • [Allow]
        • Connection
        • CSeq
        • [Date]
        • [ETag] - Used with If-Match on SETUP
        • [Public]
        • [Retry-After]
        • [Server]
        • Session
        • [Unsupported] - Sent in response to Require header
        • [Vary] - List of request header fields used to negotiate the response or "*" if something other than headers were used.
        • [Via]
        Response Entity Headers:
        • [Content-Base]
        • Content-Encoding - What decoder must be used to decode the content? No header required for identity (no encoding).
        • Content-Language
        • Content-Length
        • [Content-Location]
        • Content-Type
        • [Expires]
        • [Last-Modified]
        Parameters:
        request -
        response -
        Throws:
        IOException
        RequestException
